data.title: 如果能支持像sublime一样可以相对全项目跳转就好了，这样的话看代码非常方便
Added `scrollBounce` to `webPreferences`
When closing tab -- Cmd-D for Don't Save does not work (not keyboardable)
data.body: On Mac OS, when closing a window or tab and seeing the attached dialog, standard behavior is that Cmd-D can be used as an equivalent of clicking Don't Save. Alternatively, one should be able to use the Tab key to tab to a selection such as Don't Save. However, this dialog in recent Atom builds doesn't respond to Cmd-D or Tab, and forces mouse use.

data.title: 希望能支持像sublime一样的全项目跳转功能，我用的Python语言开发
Atom no longer option as default editor
data.body:
I upgraded to 1.11.2 yesterday, and when I went to go open a file directly today (not through Atom), Windows could no longer "find" Atom, since it was still looking in the old 1.10.0 folder. I went to change what app it opens with, and I have the option of atom.cmd, but when I run it, it opens up the ugly dialog box, but doesn't actually open the file in Atom. I can right click and see the option to open the file with Atom (though the icon has disappeared), but it just brings up the "Open file with" dialog.

Essentially, I can no longer directly open a file with Atom, short of binding it directly to the exe of the current version, which would mean having to update all my shortcuts every time I update Atom.

Interestingly, I have a start menu shortcut bound to C:\Users\Rohit\AppData\Local\atom\Update.exe --processStart "atom.exe" which still launches atom at least...

data.title: Case where TextEditor::getLastVisibleScreenRow() is off by one
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

This function:

```
atom.commands.add 'atom-text-editor:not([mini])', 'editor:scroll-down': ->
  ed = atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor()
  ed.scrollToScreenPosition([ed.getLastVisibleScreenRow()-1,0])
```

on many/most files behaves as expected, visibly scrolling the cursor down one line.

But performing it on [atom-keymap's keymap-manager.coffee](https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/blob/master/src/keymap-manager.coffee), it consistently scrolls down 2 lines.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open [atom-keymap's keymap-manager.coffee](https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/blob/master/src/keymap-manager.coffee)
2. Execute both lines in the function above via the dev tools console.

It might be necessary to change text size to reproduce, but I've seen it at the default size, too. A couple cmd-+'s then cmd-0 usually does the trick.

**Expected behavior:**

Scroll the editor down one line.

**Actual behavior:**

The editor scrolls down two lines
### Versions

Atom 1.11.1, 1.12-beta3, or master as of 18609f8
macOS 10.12 (Sierra)

data.title: Use flex display in text editor instead of block
Add language-nlf to deprecated packages
data.body: All features of `language-nlf` have been merged into `language-nsis`. The former will no longer be updated.

data.title: Automatic translation for removing Shadow DOM selectors lowers specificity
data.body: Carried over from https://github.com/lee-dohm/red-wavy-underline/issues/10 since it's more a core issue. ### Prerequisites - [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)? - [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)? - [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)? - [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? - [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? - [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide. ### Description The automatic translation for removing Shadow DOM selectors lowers specificity. This can cause some packages to break. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Checkout recent master (`1.13.0-dev-602af52` or later) 2. `apm install red-wavy-underline@0.3.0` 3. Make sure you have the [spell-check](https://atom.io/packages/spell-check) package enabled. 4. Open a file and misspell a word. Like `mispell`. **Expected behavior:** There should only be the red wavy underline. **Actual behavior:** There are the red wavy underline **and** the default dashed underline. ### Versions You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running. ``` macOS 10.12 (16A323) Atom : 1.13.0-dev-602af52 Electron: 1.3.6 Chrome : 52.0.2743.82 Node : 6.3.0 apm 1.13.0 npm 3.10.5 node 4.4.5 python 2.7.10 git 2.9.1 ``` ### Affected packages - [x] [red-wavy-underline](https://github.com/lee-dohm/red-wavy-underline/issues/10)

data.title: Can't open existing file without open editor window
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Opening an existing file doesn't work if an editing window isn't open already.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom (safe mode or normal)
2. Close Atom editor windows, but not Atom itself
3. File > Open...

**Expected behavior:** Finder opens to allow user to browse to the file they want to open.

**Actual behavior:** Nothing happens.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.11.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
OS: Mac OS 10.12.

data.title: Update takes too long: 30 minutes from 1.9.8 to 1.11.1
data.body:
### Description

Update takes too long: 30 minutes from 1.9.8 to 1.11.1 and consumes more than 400mb of traffic.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Start Atom 1.9.8
2. Go to About
3. Press Check now

**Expected behavior:** 
The latest version should be downloaded and it should happen once not in a circle.

**Actual behavior:** 
atom-1._._-delta.nupkg files were downloaded, then after delta updates were not successful atom-1.11.1-full.nupkg was downloaded.

Please, check attached log for details:
[atom-update.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/534716/atom-update.zip)

data.title: atom startup issue
data.body:
**Expected behavior:** 
I open Atom app, it opens one window, Only.

**Actual behavior:** 
I am a mac user, when I click on Atom.app or double-click to open the application, it may take a while or lag, but I often double-click just "to-be-sure". Most often what happens next is that my computer freezes because the editor is forcing many windows to open and run at the same time. I understand it is a mistake, and that I only need one window.
However is there a way to make sure that only 1 window is forced open?

Atom version 1.11.1

data.title: atom startup issue
data.body:
### Atom startup issue

I am a mac user, when I click on Atom.app or double-click to open the application, it may take a while or lag, but I often double-click just "to-be-sure". Most often what happens next is that my computer freezes because the editor is forcing many windows to open and run at the same time. I understand it is a mistake, and that I only need one window.
However is there a way to make sure that only 1 window is forced open?

Atom version 1.11.1

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: Line width marker not moved on startup
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
  **Not applicable, but probably.**
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
  **Yes.**
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
  **Not applicable, but yes.**
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
  **Not applicable, but yes.**
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
  **Yes.**
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? **Yes, using the `line in:title` search selector**
### Description

When changing the font size on startup, the line width marker is in the incorrect (old) place.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Edit your Init script (`Edit > Init script...`) to set font size on startup (e.g. by adding `atom.config.set('editor.fontSize', 1)`).
2. Zoom a little, so the line width marker is clearly visible near the middle.
3. Reopen atom.

**Expected behavior:** The line width marker is in the correct position, near the left when setting editor.fontSize to one.

**Actual behavior:** The line width marker is still in it's old positition. Zooming in or out will move the marker to the correct position.
### Versions

Atom 1.11.1
Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

data.title: CLI flag to load only particular packages
data.body: I think it would be really useful for debugging purposes if we could basically launch Atom in safe mode, but with the ability to pass specific packages to activate, enabling you to easily completely isolate a package that might be conflicting with others. Maybe something like `atom --safe -a package-name -a another-package`?
